image.altText: Cash lays on a kitchen table beside a cup of tea and a list of bills owing

props.synopsis: Inflation falls faster than expected in October, taking some pressure off the RBA to back up this month's interest rate rise with another before Christmas.

title.children: Inflation dips more than economists expect in October

image.altText: Rain drops on frangipani flowers

props.synopsis: South-east Queensland faces the possibility of giant hail, intense rainfall and destructive winds today, as a trough in the west of the state pushes east.

title.children: South-east Queensland faces possible high-end storm activity, with heatwave warnings in the north

image.altText: Meg and James hold baby Thea

props.synopsis: Better training for clinicians and postnatal support for women who experience still or neonatal death are among immediate changes being made in Queensland hospitals.

title.children: Immediate changes to be introduced in Queensland hospitals after tragic death of baby Thea

image.altText: Brittany Higgins outside court surrounded by media.

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins tells the Federal Court she was the most intoxicated she had ever been on the night in question.

title.children: Brittany Higgins details alleged rape as she takes the stand in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation action

image.altText: a woman in frame for a abc news interview

props.synopsis: Survivors receive an apology for the pharmaceutical disaster that caused distress, disability and death for many Australian families.

title.children: Apology will 'mean nothing' without action to simplify funding, thalidomide survivor says — as it happened

image.altText: Tiny Pinder

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation finds authorities missed multiple opportunities to deport an NBL player and serial rapist, despite him sexually abusing and stalking multiple women and girls in Australia.

title.children: He's a serial sexual predator who is no longer an Australian citizen. So why hasn't Tiny Pinder been deported?

image.altText: A group of people hold flashlights with their hands in the air.

props.synopsis: Qatar says it is working with both sides to try and further extend the temporary ceasefire between Hamas and Israel.

title.children: Temporary ceasefire between Israel and Hamas could be further extended

image.altText: A man looks straight ahead with green tinted sunglasses on

props.synopsis: Clare Nowland, who had dementia, died in Cooma Hospital in May a week after allegedly being tasered by Senior Constable Kristian White at her Yallambee Lodge nursing home.

title.children: NSW police officer charged with manslaughter over fatal tasering of Clare Nowland

image.altText: A man in a hat stands at a lectern

props.synopsis: The federal Member for Calare, Andrew Gee, has told parliament a package containing an "insulting" and "threatening" message was delivered to his home last week, with the alleged sender admitting it "when confronted by police".

title.children: Nationals take action against official after MP accuses her of 'nasty' delivery to his home

image.altText: A man in a green army jacket sits in a wheelchair in a clearing in a wood

props.synopsis: An officer who led his troops into one of the key initial battles of Ukraine's counteroffensive labels the operation a failure.

title.children: This Ukrainian commander says leaks, fearsome choppers and poor planning doomed the counteroffensive

image.altText: A man wearing a Ghutra sits and speaks in front of a backdrop with the 'COP28UAE' logo

props.synopsis: Leaked documents reveal the president of the UN’s global climate negotiations COP28, planned to use his role to push oil deals with other countries.

title.children: Leaked documents reveal president of the UN’s global climate negotiations used his role to push oil deals

image.altText: A shot of a busy Melbourne street with pedestrians in front of a tram.

props.synopsis: The record-breaking level of migration triggers a public debate around its impact on Australia's inflation problem and a full-blown rental crisis.

title.children: Is the record level of migration fuelling inflation and the rental crisis?

image.altText: Chief Minister of the state of Uttarakhand, greeting a worker rescued.

props.synopsis: The 41 workers, trapped for 17 days inside a collapsed tunnel in India's Uttarakhand state, were freed one at a time on wheeled stretchers through a pipe 90cm wide.

title.children: After 17 days trapped all 41 Indian tunnel workers are rescued

image.altText: Lady of justice statue outside Brisbane's Supreme and District Courts building.

props.synopsis: People could be retried for offences like manslaughter and rape under proposed changes to overhaul double jeopardy laws in Queensland.

title.children: Ten new crimes will be added to Queensland's double jeopardy legislation. Here's what it means

image.altText: A woman lying in bed blowing her nose with a tissue.

props.synopsis: After NSW Premier Chris Minns contracted the virus this week, he strongly recommended people stay at home until their COVID symptoms subside. Here's what the experts say.

title.children: Here's how long to self-isolate if you develop COVID symptoms amid Christmas peak concerns

image.altText: A supercell over Queensland

props.synopsis: Supercells are the biggest and baddest kind of severe thunderstorm, capable of producing violent winds, large hail, and tornadoes.

title.children: Eastern Australia rolling in storms and wild weather, including the most dangerous – supercell thunderstorms

image.altText: A woman smiling with her daughter

props.synopsis: Shelly struggled to get her six-year-old to eat more vegies, but a Queensland school program teaching children about growing fruit and vegetables is helping to turn that around.

title.children: School program a 'game changer' for encouraging kids to eat more fruit and vegetables

image.altText: An older woman with a dark grey bob and glasses speaks into a small microphone in front of a blue screen.

props.synopsis: The latest measure of inflation, October's monthly Consumer Price Index, comes in at 4.9 per cent, down from 5.6 per cent in the 12 months to September as the impact of 13 rate hikes flows through the economy. Follow live.

title.children: Prices rose 4.9 per cent in the year to October, RBA governor says Australians are 'doing fine'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Rate hold likely in December, February still a live option
Price changes in the 12 months to October
Interest rate hikes are working to bring down inflation

image.altText: A generic undated stock photo showing a map of Australia with heaps of pins stuck in it.

props.synopsis: While it's probably no surprise that governments spent billions of dollars fighting COVID-19, new data analysis shows how much Australians spent during the first three years of the pandemic.

title.children: How did Australia's COVID strategy compare to other countries? New data paints a striking picture

image.altText: A cockatoo flying

props.synopsis: Australian researchers and Google have launched a first-of-its-kind search engine that analyses and identifies wildlife sounds.

title.children: 'Never been done before': This audio search engine can identify Australian wildlife by the sounds they make

image.altText: A young person holding a small dog and standing outside between two armed men wearing balaclavas, standing near cars.

props.synopsis: For the first time since the truce began, both sides of the war trade accusations of serious ceasefire violations. Follow live.

title.children: Israel and Hamas trade ceasefire accusations as more prisoners and hostages are released

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Doctors Without Borders claims Israeli military blocked hospital in Jenin refugee camp
G7 foreign ministers support extension of pause in fighting in Gaza
'This truce must turn into a permanent ceasefire', Palestinian UN envoy says

image.altText: Amelia Kerr is patted on the shoulder by Georgia Redmayne after a wicket for the Brisbane Heat. Jess Jonassen is there too.

props.synopsis: The Sydney Thunder's WBBL title hopes are over after crashing to their sixth loss from their past seven games.

title.children: Heat crush Thunder to secure spot in WBBL preliminary final against Perth

image.altText: People walk in the snow.

props.synopsis: Finland will close even its most remote border crossing with Russia, drawing a line in the Arctic snow, as it looks to stop asylum seekers flooding in from Russia.

title.children: Finland draws line in Arctic snow, closing entire border with Russia

image.altText: Woman in a white and red printed shirt next to a young man in a light pink shirt at an outdoor bar.

props.synopsis: Hersh Goldberg-Polin was abducted by Hamas at the Supernova music festival in southern Israel. His mother is desperate for news about his welfare.

title.children: 'We're turning over every stone': Rachel Goldberg's battle to find her abducted son

image.altText: A woman peers to the side in front of a window wearing a black shirt

props.synopsis: As survivors of alleged historical physical and sexual abuse at the hands of foster carers in the Northern Territory seek justice, they say they are battling significant delays and distress akin to "being abused again".

title.children: Mary was repeatedly abused as a child in the foster care system. She's among dozens of survivors battling for justice

image.altText: Inactive users could see their Google Drive, Docs and Gmail erased permanently.

props.synopsis: Google will begin phase one of erasing accounts deemed inactive from the beginning of December.

title.children: Google will start deleting 'inactive' accounts from Friday. Here's how to secure your data

image.altText: Pat Cummins smiling during an interview.

props.synopsis: Since taking over the Australian cricket captaincy, Pat Cummins has been outspoken on social issues, sparking backlash and claims from critics that he had become "too woke". But he says he feels emboldened by the negative responses.

title.children: 'I know who I am': Pat Cummins on refusing to pander to a 'loud minority'

image.altText: A man is wearing a cricket helmet while holding a cricket bat with two hands.

props.synopsis: Australia pulls off a miraculous win against India, with Glenn Maxwell dragging the team to its first victory of the series.

title.children: Australia chases down mammoth Indian total thanks to record-equalling Glenn Maxwell century

image.altText: Olemedia Books AI Brain

props.synopsis: Training AI models on copyrighted materials has led to an array of high-profile lawsuits against developers such as OpenAI and Meta. Can the models be "untrained" or is the genie out of the bottle?

title.children: ChatGPT and other AI models were trained on copyrighted books. Can they be 'untrained'?

image.altText: 18-year-old autistic student Connor Winfield studies at a computer.

props.synopsis: Experts and students with lived experience warn that mainstream classrooms are critically underprepared to educate Australia's expanding cohort of autistic students.

title.children: Mainstream Australian classrooms 'not prepared' to educate the expanding cohort of autistic students

image.altText: Matildas players cheer reacting to a penalty shoot out in a large stadium

props.synopsis: The government will introduce laws to keep more content accessible on free-to-air television, and place Australian networks on a level pegging with streaming platforms on smart television home screens.

title.children: New laws to prevent 'iconic' sport moments slipping behind paywalls

image.altText: Actress Rachel Zegler gives a sarcastic bow as Lucy Gray in the Hunger Games prequel.

props.synopsis: Uli grew up in post-war Germany, so the possibility of a Hunger Games like dystopia feels like "a very real thing". This is how the film's production designer tackled the prequel.

title.children: Nazi Germany's influence on the new Hunger Games film
